com.twistral.tephrium.colors

Class PaletteExporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twistral.tephrium.colors.PaletteExporter

  • public final class PaletteExporter
extends java.lang.Object
    Helps you to export your color palettes no matter what library you are using.
    It doesn't matter if you are using LWJGL, libGDX, JavaFX, Swing etc.
    Just properly convert your colors into TColor objects and store them in a List and then pass that list into a function from this class and get your palette contents as a string. After that, you can write that content string into a file depending on your platform (PC, Android, IOS etc).

    • Constructor Summary

      PaletteExporter() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String getFileContentForGIMP(java.util.List<TColor> colors)
      Gives you the contents of a .gpl file as a string, you can write this string into a .gpl file and then use that file in GIMP or Aseprite.
      static java.lang.String getFileContentForPDN(java.util.List<TColor> colors)
      Gives you the contents of a .txt file as a string, you can write this string into a file and use it in paint.net.

    • Method Detail

      • getFileContentForGIMP

        public static java.lang.String getFileContentForGIMP(java.util.List<TColor> colors)
        Gives you the contents of a .gpl file as a string, you can write this string into a .gpl file and then use that file in GIMP or Aseprite.
        Parameters:
        colors - the color list representing your palette
        Returns:
        the contents of a .gpl file as a string

      • getFileContentForPDN

        public static java.lang.String getFileContentForPDN(java.util.List<TColor> colors)
        Gives you the contents of a .txt file as a string, you can write this string into a file and use it in paint.net.
        Parameters:
        colors - the color list representing your palette
        Returns:
        the contents of a PDN palette .txt file as a string
